    Celerity in the `lorentz` package

Photons

photon.Rd

Various functionality to deal with the 4-momentum of a photon

Usage

is.consistent.nullvec(N,TOL=1e-10)
as.photon(x,E=1)

Arguments

N

Four-momentum to be tested for nullness

TOL

tolerance

x

Vector of three-velocities

E

Energy, a scalar

Details

Returns the four-momentum of a photon.

Author

Robin K. S. Hankin

See also

4mom,reflect

Examples


## A bunch of photons all approximately parallel to the x-axis:
as.photon(as.3vel(cbind(0.9,runif(10)/1000,runif(10)/1000)))
#>       E       p_x          p_y          p_z
#>  [1,] 1 0.9999997 4.139875e-04 0.0005918422
#>  [2,] 1 0.9999997 7.199453e-04 0.0002961867
#>  [3,] 1 0.9999999 3.017502e-04 0.0002441718
#>  [4,] 1 0.9999989 1.108540e-03 0.0009851957
#>  [5,] 1 0.9999997 2.717380e-04 0.0007731885
#>  [6,] 1 0.9999993 1.069820e-03 0.0005138835
#>  [7,] 1 0.9999996 4.983983e-04 0.0007911090
#>  [8,] 1 0.9999996 8.538348e-04 0.0001215479
#>  [9,] 1 0.9999993 8.319669e-04 0.0008323975
#> [10,] 1 0.9999999 7.572303e-05 0.0005043239


## mirror ball:
jj <- matrix(rnorm(30),10,3)
disco <- sweep(matrix(rnorm(30),10,3),1,sqrt(rowSums(jj^2)),`/`)
p <- as.photon(c(1,0,0))
reflect(p,disco)
#>   E        p_x          p_y         p_z
#> x 1  0.8805221  0.430861333 -0.19758363
#> x 1  0.7634786  0.300889644 -0.57145939
#> x 1  0.9297370 -0.294966088 -0.22041792
#> x 1  0.9802704  0.174997293  0.09190189
#> x 1 -0.3830555 -0.703463193  0.59867188
#> x 1  0.9378433 -0.127538977 -0.32277518
#> x 1  0.8762111 -0.006505109 -0.48188368
#> x 1  0.8107575  0.505026162 -0.29600812
#> x 1  0.5666844  0.806840576  0.16696435
#> x 1  0.3906389 -0.905867507  0.16372332

table(reflect(p,disco)[,2]>0) # should be TRUE with probability sqrt(0.5)
#> 
#> FALSE  TRUE 
#>     1     9 

## relativistic  disco; mirror ball moves at 0.5c:

B <- boost(as.3vel(c(0.5,0,0)))
p |> tcrossprod(B) |> reflect(disco) |> tcrossprod(solve(B))
#>           t         x            y           z
#> x 0.9601740 0.9203481  0.248757906 -0.11407496
#> x 0.9211595 0.8423191  0.173718717 -0.32993223
